msItem.title: Gautreks saga
msItem.rubric: Søgu þattur af Giafa Ref Og Dala fiflumm
msItem.incipit: Gaute hefur köngur heited er ried fyrer Gautlande.
msItem.explicit: Var Hrolfur snemma mykell fyrer sier. Og enndar hier nv þott Giafa ʀefs og Dalafifla
msItem.filiation: Derived from AM 152 fol., but with the ending of the shorter version of Gautreks saga

msItem.title: Gautreks saga
msItem.incipit: I CAP. Þar hefium vier eina fräsógu af einum könng þeim er Gauti hiet.
msItem.explicit: war Hrölfur snemma mykill fyrer sier. Og enndar hier nu þätt Giafa Refs og Dalafyfla.

msItem.title: Hrólfs saga Gautrekssonar
msItem.incipit: I. CAP Þar hefium wier þessa Sógu Ad Gautrekur hefur köngur heited.
msItem.explicit: og lukum ver so sógu hrolfs kongs Gautrekssonar, hafi sa þóck er skrifadi.

msItem.title: Hervarar saga og Heiðreks
Hervarar saga ok Heiðreks konungs
msItem.rubric: Hervarar Þattur hinn gamle finnst so skrifadur Sem hier Eptterfylger
msItem.incipit: Svo finnst ritad J fórnumm Bökumm ad Jothunheimar voru kallader nordur vmm Gandvijk
msItem.explicit: Philippus atte Jngegerde dottur Haralldz kongs Sigurdssonar, war hann skamma stunnd könngur
msItem.note: Björn Jónson of Skarðsá's commentary on the Heiðreks gátur has been added. Only the upper half of fol. 95r is filled in, but with no loss of text. There was originally left space - 1 ½ pages - for the lacuna. The riddle section is written in two columns; the riddles are written in the left column with Björn's comments in the right.

msItem.title: Þorsteins þáttur bæjarmagns
Þorsteins þáttr bæjarbarns
msItem.incipit: I þann tijma er Hakon jarl Sigur[...] som ried fijrer Norege
msItem.explicit: hefur ei sydann ordid vartt vid Agda. Um sumarit epter færdi þorsteinn olafi kongi hornin Hvitinga. og sigldi epter þvi til eigna sinna og hefer sidan eigi til hans frettst. Enn er olafur kongur hvarf af orminum, hurfu eirnin hornin Hvitingar:

msItem.title: Egils saga einhenda og Ásmundar berserkjabana
msItem.incipit: Hertryggur hefur köngur heited. hann ʀied fyrer Austur j Russia.
msItem.explicit: heffur sydann einge hlutur funndist aff henne og ongvo þvi sem var á. Lukumm wier so þessare Sógu

msItem.title: Illuga saga Gríðarfóstra
msItem.incipit: Sa köngur hiet Hrijngur er ried fyrer Danmórk.
msItem.explicit: Þesse Jllugi vard sijndann föst bröder Gnodar Asmundar. Og lukumm wier hier Saugu Jlluga Gʀijdar föstra

support.note: The leaves of items 1-3 are shorter than the rest. The height in this first part is 300mm
support.watermark: There are diffrent watermarks. The watermark on fol. 87 resembles a wine glass. The watermark on fols. 62, 17 and 31 has the letters 'MC' below an image. The watermark on fols. 28 and 89-138 shows a castle with a total of three towers, a larger one in the middle and a smaller one at either side. A different castle or fortess is visible on fols. 1r-10v. This one shows three equally sized elements, a gate with a pointed roof and a flag on top, a two round tower at either side. On fols. 140-145 there is a larger image, possibly displaying a city with two circles with crosses inside them on top. The other side of these bifolia shows a small inifinity sign. The watermark on fols. 146-149 is yet a different image of a castle with again two round towers and a gate. This time the gate is considerably smaller than the towers, and the towers both have a window. Beneath the image the letter L and a star can be seen.

foliation.p: Foliated in the upper right hand corner. Due to an earlier misordering, some leaves were numbered incorrectly. The foliation was corrected twice, once by Jón Sigurðsson.

condition.p: The first part of the manuscript (items 1-3) is is good shape, the second part (items 4-7) is in worse shape, some leaves being damaged by moisture and/or wear. Text is lost on fol. 115.

handDesc.handNote: The end of Þorsteins þáttr bæjarmagns was copied onto 123v by Árni Magnússon.

decoDesc.decoNote: A single decorated initial on fol. 31r.

additions.p: There are several marginal notes, some of them most likely in Bishop Brynjólfur Sveinsson's hand.
Árni Magnússon added the final lines of Þorsteins þáttur bæjarmagns on fol. 123v.
Fols. 146-149 are later insertions, containing seventeeth century collector's accounts in Danish.

binding.p: The manuscript is bound in in a modern standard half-binding. Dimensions: 328 x 208 x 31. Strips of manuscript waste with text on them survive from an earlier binding. Some have been incorporated back into the binding at the back of the manuscript. Others are stored in the manuscript's case. The four last leaves did not originally belong to the manuscript. During an earlier binding, these leaves were inserted. The present order has been indicated by Jón Sigurðsson.

origin.p: Written in Iceland in the seventeenth century.

provenance.note: Probably a composite manuscript, as indicated by varying leaf sizes.

revisionDesc.change: Created as subset of full file on handrit.is.

Extracted pagination and page dimension data from previous version.
Extracted layout data from previous version.
